intro: Scandix brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its leaves are finely divided and have a slightly peppery aroma, similar to other members of its family. Scandix brachycarpa is often found in tundra and alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
